Title: Bens 100km Zwift cycle

Description:
On 1st May 2020, Smith Goodfellow celebrated 40 years in business. It's a huge milestone for us, especially given the current global pandemic and the impact it's having on small businesses like ours around the world.  Because community is one of the most important things to us as a business, and a team, we want to celebrate by giving back. Over the next 12 months, we will be undertaking 40 good deeds, big and small, to support our local community, other businesses and charities close to our hearts. 

We're kicking off by walking, running, cycling and dancing 400 miles in 40 days to raise money for The Trussell Trust. This is not your usual sponsored walk/cycle/run because several members of the team are self isolating - we're going to be getting creative and completing our miles in all sorts of ways, including exercise bikes, step machines! 

We've chosen to support The Trussell Trust for this because we want to support the vital service that they offer. More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year. Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure. The Trussell Trust are working closely with their network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how each food bank can be best supported in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Anything you can give to help this worthy cause will make a difference. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts for being part of our 40 year journey and for helping us give back to communities across the UK. We hope you are staying safe and well.
Title: Smith Goodfellow's 400 for 40

Description:
Due to the Coronavirus outbreak enquires to the food banks have gone up threefold and donations have plummeted. Last year food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. Just imagine that this year around 4 million food parcels  may be needed, at the point where food bank reserves are at their lowest. We need to help people with their absolute basics to get through this crisis. 

So as a light hearted incentive in troubling times I am asking you to guess Georgie’s breed makeup. Just look at those ears...who do they belong to? Does she really have donkey in her DNA or is this a red herring? We will find out exactly what she is in April......

Some clues:

She loves to snuggle up in bed

She is as fast as the speed of light.....

Cat’s however chase her

She can be a bit naughty and stubborn 

She loves all humans

She gets over excited, especially with ball games

Bees and flies ( and presumably wasps) are worth chasing



The person/s guessing the nearest combination will have a special prize. (To be decided) To enter please donate anything on this page and please leave your name.
Title: Julia's Guess The Breed Results are In

Description:
Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children.  This year the need is even greater.

Please support us by donating whatever you can to this great cause.

Thanks from

Catriona, Carl, Angela, Catlyn, Anna, Marina & Max
Title: Sage Finance Process Systems - 100km in one week!

Description:
The communities of Worcestershire have been truly amazing in supporting staff and patients of the Worcestershire hospitals through the coronavirus pandemic. The support has been overwhelming and humbling from cereal bars to hand cream and everything in between - it was so appreciated by the staff. The weekly "clap for carers" was so moving each week and really lifted our spirits in very challenging times.

Now we want to thank the communities that supported us and give a little back. We have chosen two charities to support:

- the Trussell Trust which gives essential support for those most in need

- Worcestershire Acute Hospitals Charity which provided much needed support during the pandemic by co-ordinating and distributing the 100's of items donated by the public, making sure essential items reached the front line
Title: Hospital staff either run a 10 k and cycle 30 miles for two chosen charities

Description:
The Trussell Trust run the Brixton and Norwood foodbank which is the one closest to our street and supports local families affected by poverty.

About the Trussel Trust 

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Brantwood Road Street Advent Calendar

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

My job is a financial advisor. So as you can imagine during this pandemic people have needed that advice more than ever. Whether it be financial loss, buisness impact, furlough, redundancy, job losses, illness, waiting for benefits, self employed. You name it, I've heard it. But now more than ever, I have never said so many times "are you managing to buy food on a day to day basis" and the answer being "no" then referring to food banks.This is a basic human right. All adults and children should have access to food. And it is NOTHING to be ashamed of. Under the new announcement regarding free school meals...There are too many people struggling at the moment. Please dont feel like you don't fit the "criteria" to use a food bank. If you don't have food. You fit. And we all have pride, but at a time like this there are too many adults, children and families going without. And that is not a world I want to live in. 

On a personal note, despite not being directly impacted by covid 19. Unfortunately my partner will lose his job soon due to it. And therefore as a household. We will be impacted. I'm not sure if my wage will cover my family. But I simply cannot bare the thought of my child, anyone elses child, a friend or stranger going without. And these charities are there for a reason, to be used. Me and my partner have worked our entire lives. But that doesn't mean that we won't end up struggling to pay the gas bill and buy and milk next month. And be in the same queue for the food bank with you. People from all backgrounds will rely on these places to ensure as humans we are healthy and in good shape to beat covid. No matter what it throws at us. So please use the facilities. Or please donate. A little goes a long way! 

Also, if you are struggling financially or need advice on your household bills etc. There is a free debt advice called step change or your local Citizens advice.
Title: Kirsty's FeedOurChildren

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

SANTA PUNCHES POVERTY;  donate 1.00

When somebody asks me....”are you excited about Christmas?”, my answer is ALWAYS a resounding YES!! It’s the season of goodwill, a time for friends and family, a happy time for all.....well almost all.

What if you don’t have any friends? What if you don’t have any money? What if you don’t have a home?

It is reported by local authorities that there are over 200,000 people registered as homeless here in the UK, more if you count those that “the system” misses; for more detailed information visit the following link:-

https://crisis.org.uk/media/236823/homelessness_monitor_england_2017.pdf

What will Christmas mean to this ridiculously high number of people?

The answer....the exact opposite to how you and I feel. Imagine how being cold and hungry throughout our winter months feels.......try it for a night, I guarantee you’ll not be doing it again.

Homelessness affects people of all ages, old, young, middle aged....a high percentage suffering with a Mental Health issue.

So if you’re willing, here’s what I suggest we do, either donate just 1.00 direct to the Trussell Trust to support their campaign “stopping UK hunger”.

A link to the Trussel Trusts website directory is below:-

https://www.trusselltrust.org/

OR.....

Imagine what a MASSIVE difference it would make to our country’s needy if every day throughout December we all put aside at least 1 tin or packet of food as a donation, and once a week delivered what we have collected to a local Food-Bank?

The Trussell Trust, a fantastic charity trying to “stop UK hunger”, have a searchable directory of Food-Banks listed on their website that rely almost entirely on the general public for food and drink donations. I guarantee that every single one of these Food-Banks will be inundated with requests for food and drink from Britain's Homeless over the coming festive season.

If you’re up for the challenge, register here, visit the Trussell Trusts website to locate your nearest Food-Bank, and let’s start giving.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/santa-punches-poverty-tickets-39698608607

One last thing to ask, let’s flood Social Media with the tag #santapunchespoverty and show our support for the UK‘s homeless society, showing the powers that be that homelessness is simply not acceptable in this day and age.

Thank you for reading, and let’s give generously!

Please feel free to post photographs of you and your family and friends "giving" on yours and my Twitter page.

Dave

@secbus

Title: 200km Run in May

Description:
Unprecedented times call for unprecedented measures.  

I've always admired the Mohican, I think the office would have loved it.  I can imagine them bursting into smiles as I came in for the first time after having one.   

I'll be at home for the foreseeable future and willing to get this much desired haircut, groomed expertly by my household quarantine mate Giedre.  

All it takes to get this off the ground is for you, my friends and family, to donate £100 to instant neighbor to provide emergency food parcels to those in need along with nappies and essential babycare equipment to parents in need in Aberdeen area. 

If we got to £200, I'd dyed it yellow like the picture.  Let's see how it goes...  Monday the clippers come out!
Title: Gary Gary's Going Mohican

Description:
1 in 5 people live below the poverty line.  

Me and Elise want to raise as much money as we can so  we can deliver much needed items to local foodbanks over the Christmas period. 

Making a choice between food and  presents for my children this Christmas is not a decision I will have  to make and we hope anyone reading this is also fortunate enough. 

Christmas should be full of magic and joy as well as giving so please  donate what ever you can  x x
Title: Help Families over Christmas

Description:
Through out everyones life there will be moments when your mental health is tested. This year has been a challenge to our mental health and wellbeing, some more than others. Our physical health plays such a key role to help improve our mental health and wellbeing. It is proven that going outdoors for physical exercise improves how we feel. With this second lockdown the weather being colder and the dark nights pulling in its harder to get that motivation to go outdoors. 

So with this in mind, on the weekend of the 28th November (Saturday & Sunday) as a team at Lloyds Bank Great Yarmouth & Gorleston, we will all be taking part to complete a virtual challenge of London to Paris (299 miles). All of the team will be challenging themselves to get outdoors to walk, run and/or bike over the weekend to raise funds for this great charity. 

In these difficult financial times your finances may stretched but if you can please help support UK mental health to provide invaluable support and services for those at need by sponsoring us. Everything we sponsored will be matched by Lloyds Bank to double the money raised going to Charity.

I would imagine we all know somebody who has been affected by this invisible illness. 

Mental health UK supports people affected by mental health problems including friends, family and carers. Working across the UK providing support groups, advice & support on mental health & money, information and online platforms to support anyone. 

Thanks for taking the time to sponsor us. 

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Great Yarmouth Lloyds Bank Virtual Challenge from London to Paris

Description:
For all of us, there are a fair few things we thought we'd be doing this year, that never actually happened. For a lot of people, this pandemic has also meant they are doing things they never thought they would have to.


Like relying on a food bank to feed their family.
In spring 2020, 50% of people who were visiting Trussell Trust food banks were doing so for the very first time. The Trussell Trust network are expecting to hand out six emergency food parcels every minute throughout winter.


On Sunday, I am doing something I would never have done if it weren’t for the pandemic. I’ll be running the Virtual “New York” Marathon and I want to use this as an opportunity to raise some money for those who really need it.


If you can afford to, please do pop a few pounds in to the fundraising page. It will be my fifth time running the marathon distance, but definitely the most difficult…

I’ll be running in intervals with a half mile walking break every four miles, I’m expecting to be at least an hour slower than my fastest marathon time, and instead of following the thousands of people in front of me, I’ll have to remember where I’m going all by myself!


If you are around on Sunday and fancy giving me a cheer, let me know and I can share my route and rough times I’ll be expecting to pass by

Title: Neil's Walking Runcorn bus network page

Description:
Cyril, aged 6, decided to shave his head for the 'Trussell Trust' which is a vital food bank for people who are struggling financially. So many more people are struggling in these hard times.

I thought I'd keep him company and shave my head...again! 

Last time I did this was 2015 when my oldest, Olive, was nearly 3 and Cyril was 18 months. My youngest, Maud, is now 2 and a half. I raised £5000 for Cancer Research, as a joint effort with a friend, and donated my hair to 'The Little Princess Trust' who make wigs for children that have lost their hair due to cancer treatments.

I hope to donate to The Little Princess Trust again when they are up and running again. Blonde hair this time!

I am not expecting to raise anything near £5000 this time due to the current financial worries a lot of people will be faced with.

If all this does is save me from the worst root regrowth then so be it! 

Some people said bald suited me last time- it didn't and certainly doesn't this time as I am fatter, paler and older!

We are asking for anyone who can spare anything at all to donate to this worthy cause please and/or 'Share' as much as you can on any social media! 

Thank you,

Cyril and Claire. xxx

Title: Georgie's epic camp out

Description: Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. I’m not running a marathon or doing anything heroic like that, I just want to try to raise a bit of money to support The Trussell Trust, the UK’s main food bank charity, because I believe coronavirus panic buying at supermarkets by people who can financially afford to panic buy is wiping supermarket shelves clean of even the absolute basic essentials that people less fortunate than many of us can barely afford anyway. If you yourself have a few quid to spare, please help. What’s £10? A packet of fags or a takeaway pizza. Please help stop the Coronavirus Poverty Gap.
Title: Jonathan's Stop The Coronavirus Poverty Gap

Description:
Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

With Manchester Marathon being cancelled I will be running marathon distance locally to raise money for the trussel trust

I know this is an uncertain time financially for many so I understand if people are unable to donate. But if you are able to spare any donations that would be fantastic. 

THANKS

Hannah :)
Title: Manchester marathon for the trussel trust

Description: More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year. Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure. Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Title: THE STAY SAFE SHOW

Description:
Food banks were important before, but they'll be even more essential during this Corona nightmare. 

So I'm letting 3 year old cassie try to shave my head. And I'll keep whatever that ends up with for at least 1 day, before I let my wife shave me number 1 bald.

Title: A 3 year old shaves Eoin's head

Description:
In this period of Coronavirus lockdown there is increased pressure on the food banks for a variety of reasons:-

  • Unexpected job losses and increase in demand for supplies.
  • Regular donators being on lockdown.
  • Supermarket restrictions on purchasing multiple items.
  • Closure of many community buildings which act as drop off points for donations.

There is an amazing team of people working in the Bromley warehouse and in the centres, but they can only work with what has been donated.

Last year, food banks in their network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, they can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

I am hoping that I can help to raise funds to help them to keep supporting those that need them in the community.

I will buzz cut my hair to No. 6 all over if my full target is met. If I don't meet the target I should still like to keep your donations and would be happy to sport a suitable haircut commensurate with the amount raised - the more money, the more extreme. If I smash my target it could be a No 5 or shorter!!!

Please help.
Title: Miss Denton's 'Head Shave' Challenge

Description:
August 2021 update: I’ll be riding a 5-day bike tour around southern England, starting with a loop around the North Downs, then riding from Guildford to Salisbury, the New Forest, Portsmouth, round the Isle of Wight and back to Guildford. After such generous sponsorship last year, I’m not pushing for it this time but there remains great need for the Trussell Trust food banks, even more so now with supermarket shortages and Brexit price rises. So if you’ve made it here, please consider a kind donation while I ride with a strapped-up hamstring!

______________________________________________________

To mark turning 50, I’ve been planning to cycle the story of my life, from where I was born, Guisborough in the North Riding of Yorkshire, via all the places in this country I’ve lived in – taking in Kirby, Oxford, Reading, Guildford, Reigate and London – to end in Cambridge.

It was just going to be a personal challenge to mark a significant milestone. However, having spent my 50th birthday in the pandemic lockdown, I wanted to turn the bike tour into a chance to raise money for the Trussell Trust, whose food banks so many people rely on and which sadly is in even greater demand now as the severe economic hardship for many during this crisis intensifies.

I will be setting off on Sunday 19th July. I’ll provide updates throughout the bike tour on my dedicated Twitter account: https://twitter.com/phil50biketour

Thank you for anything you are able to give to help the Trussell Trust help those who most need it.

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, the Trussell Trust can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Phil 50 bike tour (the story of my life)

Title: David's isolation cut - hair to impress!

Description:
Inspired by other similar charity events I have decided to complete my staircase version of the three peaks challenge. Anyone who knows me will be familiar with my love of the mountains, obviously I can’t get out there at the moment, so I have decided to climb the equivalent combined  height of the highest peaks in Scotland, Wales and England (not Britain’s there highest peaks - they're all in Scotland). I’m trying to raise money for the Trussel Trust who provide much needed food banks across the country, sadly needed at the best of times but even more important at this time of crisis. Please help me.

I need to ascend 15,660 steps in total. That’s 1205 times up and down the stairs.

Scafell Pike 4500 steps, Snowdon 4610 steps, Ben Nevis 6550 steps.

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Stephen's Three Peak Challenge - Staircase version

Description:
I'm taking part in the Stay At Home Sleepout to raise funds for people who are homeless and in poverty. The money raised will go towards supporting local food banks that help the homeless and vulnerable gain access to vital supplies.

Now more than ever there are millions of people relying on food banks to help feed themselves and their family, if you are in a position to help I would love if you could donate to help support the cause! 

What I'm actually doing:

Come 8PM June 1st I will be taking up residence in my back garden until the following morning, sleeping out in a sleeping bag. I am hoping that it doesn't rain otherwise it will be a very soggy experience indeed, however, even if it did, I have the luxury of going back inside the following morning, having a hot meal and a bath whereas the people we are hoping to help do not, they have no home. 

Anyone that knows me knows I hate shadowy places and things that go bump in the night so sleeping outside without the comfort of a tent is so not my thing! I will be posting updates throughout the night and hopefully be able to raise some money to help those in need! 

Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page :)

Title: Alun's 100 stairs a day challenge

Description:
We have decided to have some fun, put down our screens and raise money for a well deserving cause. 

We are swimming 21 miles (33.8km) in our garden pool, that’s 5200 lengths. We are currently 7.7kms from Dover (virtually of course!) and we plan to reach Calais by the end of May!

We know we are a very fortunate family of four so we have decided to raise money for the Trussell Trust, who provide much needed food and basic supplies to families across the UK from their network of over 1,200 food banks.

The Trussell Trust

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: The Aquaticuffs Virtually Swim the English Channel

Description:
“ No human should go to sleep without food “

We are two typical 15 year olds. We enjoy activities such as gaming, watching Netflix and hanging out with friends. However COVID-19 has changed everything around us, which also meant that we could not meet  each other and our friends in lockdown. This period of uncertainty made us realise that there are so many people out there who are not as fortunate as us, cannot even afford food and  starving for days ! These people need our urgent help in this Pandemic.

This is why we have decided to challenge ourselves to walk 40 km in a single day from Bourne End  to Reading on weekend of 25th July.

We have chosen to raise money for “The  Trussel trust “. We believe that they are the right organisation to help the hungry in these difficult times.

We would be very grateful if you can make a difference in their lives by supporting us on this  journey and save many lives  as every penny counts and every little helps. Thank you for reading our story and we hope you can help this noble cause. !

“ There is  no exercise better for the heart than reaching down and lifting people up “ very powerful line by John Holmes.

Thanks and regards

Sarth and Aditya
Title: Sarth and Aditya 40 KM walk

Description:
In this time of unprecedented crisis, many have lost their livelihoods and income meaning food security has become an even greater concern within our community and food banks are vital. 

In an effort to fundraise for The Trussell Trust food bank network I will be shaving my head and donating my hair to the Little Princess Trust who provide free, real hair wigs to children with hair loss and fund crucial research into childhood cancers. 

Unfortunately, given the current situation, the Little Princess Trust are understandably unable to receive hair donations and I won’t be able to shave my head until they can. 

However, considering the recent enforcements made to prevent virus spread, food aid is needed urgently and any donations, no matter the size, will be greatly appreciated by myself, The Trussell Trust and any person relying on food banks to stay safe and fed in this trying time. Even £2 can make a difference x

Title: Shaving my head for The Trussell Trust

Description:
After a mixture of wanting to take part in the charitable challenges, and also wanting to do something to help those less fortunate in these lockdown days days... I decided to set a challenge to some friends. There are several great efforts going on to raise money for the NHS charities, so I thought i’d go with something that is local to many of my friends and colleagues - this is the area right next to Dell Glasgow (remember that place!?)

Challenge is simple (but not easy!) & for the golfers out there, but anyone can try it!

Just like several similar challenges, the golfer needs to get 20 balls, place a bucket, basin or plant pot etc. 10 feet away. Film yourself hitting all 20 and for everyone you get in the bucket - donate (a minimum) of £2.00 to the just giving page below.

https://www.justgiving.com/fundraising/carlo-cocozza

The idea is to get a lot of people taking part, so please post your video and nominate another garden golfer!

If you are tagged in this, you are nominated 😉 good luck!

Eg get 1 out of 20, donate £2 (or whatever you choose).
Get none in, donate at least £2 anyway. Every ‘ball in the bucket’ could be a meal for someone.

Title: Carlo's Garden Golf Bucket challenge

Description:
Action Hands is a community campaign launched during COVID19 by London Nursery Schools (LNS) founder Sara Brennan, Amanda Frolich and Alison Wheeler to support the well being of young children and families through music and play. 

With this song "Time To Shine", The Action Hands team is raising funds for the Trussell Trust to provide food for families in need during COVID19. 

Last year, Trussell Trust food banks provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. The Trussell Trust aims to end the need for food banks. As a nation, The Trussell Trust believes no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Thank you for watching our video Time To Shine.  

https://youtu.be/LcEJ-2WptvM

It is a cause very close to our hearts and we hope you can show your support for this worthy cause.  The song will be available soon to purchase and download on all the regular digital platforms.  All profits from the downloads will also go to The Trussell Trust.  

Keep safe everyone!

With love

Action Hands   

(Sara/Amanda/Alison)

Title: Tunbridge Wells Online Virtual Christmas Market

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Since 2012 the FoodBank have been supporting people from Kingsbridge, Salcombe and the surrounding parishes.  

As a direct result of Covid-19 the area we cover has grown to Kingsbridge, Salcombe, Modbury and the surrounding 26 parishes....

As October ends there is still NO normal!!
It looks like there is going to be a second period of lock-down which will affect so many of our local families and individuals and the number of Covid cases IS slowly increasing.

We really need to stick together as a community, to make sure that everyone who needs help CAN access it, easily.
The FoodBank have been assisting local residents since March with Food, Prescriptions, Shopping and other errands. 

It's really starting to look like Christmas is going to be VERY different from any other! We're asking for your help to limit the impact on the most vulnerable people in our society in the run up and over the school holidays.

Title: Chantal's Christmas

Description:
Why am I asking for your money?

My wife and children decided to volunteer at the Kingsbridge Area Foodbank at the start of the Covid-19 outbreak. The children are keen participants in the Malborough and District Kids theatre group and the pantos so they have created a song. You can see their customised version of ”Where is love” from Oliver here: youtu.be/qBhFYFel4lw to try and persuade you all to donate some money to the Foodbank's cause. Please watch the video and give whatever you can spare to help support families in need.

Who will receive the money

The Kingsbridge Area Foodbank is a wonderful organisation that has been supporting families and individuals for 8 years but lately the demand for their services has soared to new levels. My wife chose to volunteer with the foodbank, while on furlough from her job in Kingsbridge, and has seen the enormous pressure they are suddenly under. I think the numbers of people being helped have jumped from around 25 to 110 per week. They have already had some very kind donations but, as you can imagine, the demand is using up the money fast. To try and raise money my children came up with the idea of singing a song here so please give it a watch and, if you can, donate to this worthwhile cause.

Why you really should care

I wanted to mention one last thing that has really stuck with my wife. when she visited a family recently. The main earner was self-employed and his business had been forced to stop. As you may know, that means the family will not receive support until June. The lady that answered the door ended up in tears as she explained that she never expected to be in this situation. I have to admit it was very moving to hear her story but thank goodness the Foodbank has been able to help. Please help if you can and if, like the lady above, you find yourself in need, get in touch. There is no judgement, they just want to help.

Thank you and stay safe,

Jason, Tamara, Olly and Charlotte
Title: Charity Song for Kingsbridge Foodbank

Description:

We have chosen Nourish as our charity which is a local food bank in Tunbridge Wells.  There are lots of people who will be struggling to feed themselves and their families because they are unable to work because of Coronavirus.

Thank you for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

As a school we have worked with this incredible charity for some time but over recent weeks and days Nourish have been at the forefront of our minds. 

Many pupils, staff and families from Holmewood House have been wanting to get involved in some way to help our wider community during these difficult and uncertain times of COVID-19.

Nourish is a registered charity that provides short-term emergency provisions, support and signposting in a crisis to individuals and families within the borough of Tunbridge Wells, South Tonbridge and the surrounding areas.

Their  mission is that no-one need go hungry in Tunbridge Wells and the surrounding areas.

We are therefore reaching out to the friends and families of our Holmewood community to invite them to give their support in any way that they can.

Thank you.
Title: Holmewood House School

Description:
We have been blown away by the kindness, generosity and support to Ben and for this important local charity.

5-year-old Ben was diagnosed with Nance-Horan Syndrome, an extremely rare genetic disease, at just 2 weeks old. As a blue badge holder and formally registered as severely visually impaired in both eyes, Ben has undergone multiple eye operations in his lifetime at Addenbrookes Hospital, Cambridge. We are incredibly grateful for all the medical care he has received from many specialists over the last 5 years, at not only Addenbrooke’s, but also Moorfields, Hertfordshire, Lister and Great Ormond Street Hospitals. We are also extremely grateful to the VI educational specialist team at Herts Council. 

Ben wears special contact lenses to give him a focus range of  approximately 70cm; without them he can only see light as he has no lenses inside his eyes. Having received specialist care and support throughout his lifetime, Ben’s older sisters, 8 year-old Alice  and 10 year-old Jessica are dedicated to helping their brother and have supported him every step of the way.

Inspired by his sisters, Ben decided to take on a climbing challenge in aid of the Bishop’s Stortford Food Bank to kickstart his school fundraising. Over the weekend Ben visited Clip’n’Climb, Cambridge for the first time, and completed his sponsored climb with Jess and Alice. Encouraged by his sisters and family, Ben climbed to the top of 10 different walls a total of 30 times. Ben’s visual impairment means that a lot of this was done through touch alone.

This challenge was arranged extremely quickly (within a day!) due to current circumstances around Covid19 and possible new lockdown measures on the way. £1035.00 was initially raised on Sunday by family, friends and neighbours for Ben’s climb. We are really glad Ben had the opportunity to climb and we are all so grateful to everyone who has donated money to him. Our local food bank is incredibly important and a very worthy cause, especially right now in these very challenging times. Thank you ever so much. ❤️🧗💪
Title: Ben Hardy's Sponsored Climb

Description:
My sister and I are taking part in the Hatfield Broad Oak 10k race in support of our local food bank.  As a short, fat, unfit man, I'm not aiming for a time - I just plan on finishing it.

Bishop's Stortford might be an affluent area but there are pockets of deprivation.  Because people often assume everyone this way is well off, help for people in poverty here is limited.  Food poverty is a real thing in our community.  No child should go hungry yet every day they do.  That is why we are running to raise money for the local food bank.

CharityName: The Food Bank (an initiative of Into the Community)
Description:
Amidst the Coronavirus crisis, the people of Milton Keynes are in dire need of our local foodbank more than ever before. Whole families in previously secure jobs have suddenly found themselves thrust into poverty and struggling to put food on the table, through no fault of their own. And the worst is yet to come. 

The foodbank is struggling to meet demand, with food packages going out as soon as the donations come in.

The people of MK need your help now more than ever. I know finances are tight for all of us right now, but please if you can spare even a small amount, you'll be making a big difference right now!

My goal is to cycle 200 miles over the next 30 days, in order to help raise funds, support and feed those in need. Please, let's all chip in to help those who are really in a desperate place right now...
Title: Joe's Cycle 200

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

My name is Alice. I am nine years old  and I live in Bishop's Stortford . Like most children I am home from school, this upsets me because it means I can't visit my grandparents in the Easter holidays which I was looking forward to doing. Instead I have decided to virtually cycle to them in April, starting with Nanny in Bishop's Stortford and finishing with Grandmaman and Grandpa in Dorset. This means cycling, on our exercise bike, about 7k every day throughout April to make it up to 206k to reach Dorset by the end of the month. I have decided to do this to keep active and raise money for the Bishop's Stortford food bank, as I feel they will need donations even more so during this outbreak.

Title: GRENKE Agency NI 1.5 Million steps in 30 Days

Description:
As we are living in the current pandemic and the government restrictions are continuing to severely impact all of us, now is the time we all need to dig deep and keep each other going. Half term is approaching...with social distancing measures in place and play centres closed, it's important to keep ourselves and the kids active and occupied.

This is why I have come up with the idea of ‘Kilometres for our Community’ to keep active and whilst doing so, give something back to those who need it most. The challenge is to complete a run, walk or bike either on your own or with the kids, and donate the distance covered back in pounds. So 1k completed is £1 donated and so on...
Whether you complete 1km or 100km no donation is too small!!

I know that now is not the most ideal of times to be asking for money so I really do mean it when I say no donation is too small.

Let's make it fun! Get out in our wellies/trainees or muddy on our bikes. Lets keep that smile on our faces and more importantly, help towards putting one on those who need us too.

All donations will go directly to this great place, St Andrew's Community Network within our local area, who aim to provide a range of services including a foodbank which is needed now more than ever.

So get your shoes/boots/wellies on and let's get going :-)

Thank you for your time x

Description: Twenty four hours a day, every day of the year. The Salvation Army provide care and support to people in need. In fact its what we've done for over 150 years. It is what we continue to do today and its what we will go on doing whenever and wherever there is injustice and pain in the world. We help people affected by disasters or financial troubles. We help people who are experiencing homelessness or escaping violence We help people trapped in addiction or battling mental illness We help anyone feeling hopeless. We help those who find it difficult to put food on the table through our food bank. We are a community- a movement of people fighting injustice. Our donors and supporters- people like you- are as much a part of The Salvation Army as those working in our recovery centres or regional communities. Together we offer unconditional love and support, without discrimination. The Salvation Army is committed to delivering innovative and progressive services that empower people beyond their circumstances. Our services are as diverse as the areas of need within the

Description:
As an under 15's football squad we want to help end the need to food banks across the UK. We share the philosophy of the Trussell Trust in that no-one in the UK should ever go hungry, so we we're aiming to do as much as we can to help raise funds for them.

We're going for 25,000 pushups, situps or squats across the whole of November and if we can, go even further!!!

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks. As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

Everyone hates burpees. Fact. What began as a challenge between friends we hope can turn into something good that can raise funds for the Lewisham food bank who are doing amazing things to look after the most vulnerable in our local community.

So, we have set ourselves the challenge of doing 1,000 burpees (each) in a day. It won’t be easy but hopefully knowing we are making a difference to those who need it most during these tough times will get us through!

The Lewisham food bank is part of a network of over 400 food banks, working to tackle food poverty and hunger in our local community, as well as across the UK. They provide food to those in need - something of particular importance as we fight the current Coronavirus. 

We hope our efforts will help raise funds for the food bank and awareness of all the good they are doing within our local community. Any donations would be very much appreciated!
Title: Steve and James do the 1,000 burpee challenge!

Description:
On the 20th May 2020 join the Great British Fast for Food Banks

Donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today!  


The national press have reported that, due to COVID-19, the number of people forced into hardship has increased.  Use of Food Banks has in some cases more than doubled. 

At the same time, due to the lockdown, donations have slowed.


We have to come together as a country and make sure support is there to protect people from food poverty during this emergency!


It also happens to be the month of Ramadan, when people of the Muslim faith refrain from eating and drinking from dawn to dusk.  Given the nature of the crisis, it seemed a fitting theme for this fundraising effort.


Please donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today, and if you can, on Wednesday the 20th May 2020, people of all faiths and those of no faith, try and fast in support of those in the UK and around the world who are having to go without.



Once you have donated, tag in at least 5 of your friends and get them to join you in making this a huge national effort.


What does a fast entail?  Well, traditionally, going without food or drink from sunrise to sunset (Google can tell you the times).  If that seems a bit much, simply sacrifice whatever you are comfortable with, even if that's just your second Double Decker from the tuck shop at elevenses.


Of course, you don't have to fast if you don't want to, or if you have a medical condition, are taking medication, are pregnant, or really just find it too daunting an ordeal, please do not fast, but still please make whatever donation you feel comfortable making.


However much we raise for Food Banks is better than nothing!


Let's try to get these hashtags trending on social media with stories about what you are giving up, how your fast was, ideas, thoughts, videos and good wishes - and let's just see what happens.

#GreatBritishFast

#fast4foodbanks 


If this is successful as a campaign, perhaps we can run it again, maybe even one day a month, for as long as the Trussell Trust is needed in the UK to prevent people from falling into such hardship.


With Grace, who knows what we might achieve together.


The below is a message from the Trussell Trust so you can see the incredible work they do and the challenges they are facing.

.......

More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.  Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank.
As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: The Great British Fast

Description:
Feeding Families: Covid-19 Emergency Appeal

The ongoing lockdown is affecting us all, but for many families living in the slums of Kampala it has been devastating.

To meet this crisis, Kids Club Kampala - a small but ambitious and impactful charity, with a small team in the UK, and a team in Kampala employing local Ugandans - are running emergency food banks for vulnerable families to get them through this time.

They have already provided 982,107 emergency food packages, but need further help.

I have joined a collective challenge to run, skip and cycle the distance from here to Uganda along with a bigger team of about a dozen of us. We will be completing 1600 miles in total over a 10 week period. I have pledged to cover 200 miles by the end of August.

Each of us is aiming to raise £300 from our own networks and friends. We really appreciate any of your support especially during this uncertain time for everyone.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: Ruthie's page

Description:
While we're all stuck at home, I wanted to do something to put a smile on your face, and raise some money for the Trussell Trust. The national charity's network of food banks are expecting to see an increase in need over the coming weeks as the coronavirus pandemic unfolds.

To help, and hopefully(!) brighten up your day, I am dedicating my mornings to video call as many of you who donate as possible. All you need to do is donate to the Trussell Trust on this page, ensure your phone number is included in your donation, and tick that you are happy to receive further communications so that I am allowed to call you!

By donating, not only will you be in for the chance of a receiving a video call from me, but you will also help people struggling as a result of the coronavirus pandemic. 

Food banks were already seeing an increased need before this outbreak but it's likely that more people than ever will be unable to afford their own food over the coming weeks, especially people who have unstable jobs or who aren't eligible for sick pay, and will need to turn to a food bank for support. 

Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trust’s network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over half a million of these of these going to children. 

Your donations will help the Trussell Trust support food banks in their network and ensure people in crisis can access emergency food during this challenging time. This money could help fund vans to help food banks deliver food to people's homes, buy food (if necessary and available!), recruit additional staff to meet the demand, but also, vitally, campaign for change so that everyone can afford their own food. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this and I look forward to chatting to a few of you over the coming days.

NOW FOR THE LEGAL PART: 

All funds raised will go directly to the Trussell Trust. You can find out more about the organisation on their website www.trusselltrust.org. 

I will try to call as many of you as possible but it might not be possible to speak to everyone who donates. 

Please note that I can only contact you if you provide a phone number and ‘opt in’ to share their details with the Trussell Trust. 

The Trussell Trust is committed to protecting your privacy and will process any personal data in accordance with the General Data Protection Act 2018. Your details will be kept safe and secure, only used by the Trussell Trust or those who work for us and will not be shared, sold or rented to third parties for marketing purposes. In this instance, your details (first name, phone number and amount donated), will be shared with Michael McIntyre for the purposes of this fundraising event only.

We may use information you provide for analysis, research or screening purposes in order to help us understand our supporters so that we can save resources and deliver the best possible service.
Title: Michael McIntyre is supporting the Trussell Trust

Description:
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.

Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank. As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.

Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that theyre able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.
Title: Elizabeth's Keep on playing

Description:
On the 20th May 2020 join the Great British Fast for Food Banks
Donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today!  


The national press have reported that, due to COVID-19, the number of people forced into hardship has increased.  Use of Food Banks has in some cases more than doubled. 
At the same time, due to the lockdown, donations have slowed.

We have to come together as a country and make sure support is there to protect people from food poverty during this emergency!

It also happens to be the month of Ramadan, when people of the Muslim faith refrain from eating and drinking from dawn to dusk.  Given the nature of the crisis, it seemed a fitting theme for this fundraising effort.

Please donate the price of a meal (or more) to the Trussell Trust today, and if you can, on Wednesday the 20th May 2020, people of all faiths and those of no faith, try and fast in support of those in the UK and around the world who are having to go without.


Once you have donated, tag in at least 5 of your friends and get them to join you in making this a huge national effort.


What does a fast entail?  Well, traditionally, going without food or drink from sunrise to sunset (Google can tell you the times).  If that seems a bit much, simply sacrifice whatever you are comfortable with, even if that's just your second Double Decker from the tuck shop at elevenses.

Of course, you don't have to fast if you don't want to, or if you have a medical condition, are taking medication, are pregnant, or really just find it too daunting an ordeal, please do not fast, but still please make whatever donation you feel comfortable making.

However much we raise for Food Banks is better than nothing!

Let's try to get these hashtags trending on social media with stories about what you are giving up, how your fast was, ideas, thoughts, videos and good wishes - and let's just see what happens.
#GreatBritishFast
#fast4foodbanks 

If this is successful as a campaign, perhaps we can run it again, maybe even one day a month, for as long as the Trussell Trust is needed in the UK to prevent people from falling into such hardship.


With Grace, who knows what we might achieve together.

The below is a message from the Trussell Trust so you can see the incredible work they do and the challenges they are facing.
.......
More and more people are being forced to use food banks because they cannot afford the basics in life. Last year, food banks in the Trussell Trusts network provided 1.6 million three-day emergency food parcels to people in crisis, with over 500,000 of these going to children. This was an increase of almost 20% on the previous year.  Now, as the Coronavirus pandemic develops, its likely that increasing numbers of people will need support from their local food bank.
As food bank staff and volunteers work to source and distribute food to people who need support, their resources are becoming increasingly stretched as they come under additional pressure.Were working closely with our network of over 1,200 food banks to work out how we can best support each food bank in the coming months to make sure that they're able to continue to help people in crisis in their local communities.

Title: Teresa is taking part in The Uckghelpcentre Five Alive

Description:
Please join me on the Boxing Day 2019 from Midday for my charity stream to help raise as much money as we can for such an amazing cause.

You can find me at www.twitch.tv/nelinde

If you can't make a donation fear not! You can help by spreading the word and sharing this JustGiving page on social media and with friends and family.


No one should go hungry, especially at Xmas! 

Yet thousands of families are going without food due to poverty, parents going without so their children don't have empty bellies.

This is 2019! This shouldn't even be a thing... Sadly so many people in the UK are in this dire situation. It could be a neighbour or even a family member!

UK Food Banks are vastly overstretched and are in need of food donations more than ever before to meet the highest demands ever to be recorded since the Trussell Trust started in 1999!


But you can help spread a little Xmas cheer <3 


Please spare what you can afford, as little as £2 can afford a single meal!

You can also help by donating any spare "long shelf life" foods such as tinned vegetables etc to your local Food Bank or supermarket Food Bank collection box <3

Having personally relied on my local Food Bank in previous times of hardship I have first hand experience of the effect and contribution Food Banks have on so many people facing financial hardship and not being able to afford food for their families or themselves. They provide a light in times of darkness, often providing much more than just food. 

They offer an ear to listen, a personal connection where there is nothing but loneliness. Many Food Banks even provide clothing that they've had donated. My local Food Bank even run a free playgroup where parents can go to meet other parents and make friendships.

I can't stress how much a small donation can help <3

Title: 100km in a Day Cycle Challenge

Description:
I set this page up for last year's marathon but it was then cancelled and this year's one moved to October. 

Before Christmas 2020 I read a lot about food banks in the UK and found it quite shocking. Not a lot has changed now and so I want to try to raise some more money. There are more people using them than ever in many parts of the country, and the Trussell Trust support a nationwide network of over 1200 food banks. They provide emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, and campaign for change to end the need for food banks in the UK.

Between April 2019 and March 2020, food banks in the Trussell Trust network provided a record 1.9 million food supplies to people in crisis, an 18% increase on the previous year and during the coronavirus pandemic food banks have seen need rise even further.

I know I have run the marathon before, and I know I have asked for donations before. But this seems like a really worthy cause and an issue that worries me a lot so I hope people will find a few spare quid to donate. I will definitely top up the final total myself too as I feel in a very fortunate to be running the London Marathon and want to complete the race knowing it has also done some good. 

If you are a UK taxpayers and want to sponsor me please tick the Gift Aid box. This enables them to claim an extra 25p per £1 you donate at no extra cost to you. A £10 donation will be transformed into £12.50 and makes a huge difference so please do so. 

Many thanks 

Jeffers

Description: Galvanised by the belief that being clean is not a luxury or a privilege, The Hygiene Bank is a registered, people powered, grassroots charity grounded in community. We collect and re-distribute donated toiletries, hygiene, beauty and personal care items to UK charities, voluntary organisations and schools. These in turn are then given for free to their beneficiaries. Our passion stems from a sense of injustice: it's not right that anyone should face hygiene poverty in modern Britain.

Title: Pierre Fabre Supports Its in the Bag 2020

Description:
Hello, thanks for stopping by.

I am supporting the PTA at Michaela's school, because they always try so hard to bring creative ways to raise funds for the school. Even during a national lockdown they have thought of a way to raise money. 

And, I want to teach my daughter that getting involved with community events for her school and the wider community is a good and positive thing. I want to teach her that it is important to get involved, not only to raise money to help her school, but also because this time we are raising money for children in the local community who don't have enough for a good Christmas. Half of the money we raise will go towards a toy and food appeal for the children in our community. And that lesson is important to learn.

So we have decided to get on board and help out. She will cycle twice around Fog Lane park which is about 2 kilometers. And I will jog alongside her. She has not been riding on two wheels for very long, but I believe in her, that she can and will manage this challenge. I have not run for about 9 years. Every time I try, I either injure my knee or ankle. But, I'm willing to give it a go. I may have to end up walking it. But I'm doing this for my daughter who is doing it for her school and for other children so that they can have a warm meal for Christmas.

Every donation, no matter the size, will be hugely appreciated.

Thank-you for taking the time to read this. 


Toubie and Michaela

Title: Be Someone's Hero this Christmas

Description:
We have foolishly signed up to burn 15,000 EXTRA calories as a team over 7 days in order to ensure that the Felix Project can deliver 100,000 free meals to homeless and vulnerable people during the festive season. Help us to help them! 

--

The mission of the Felix Project is simple - to take surplus food from their suppliers and deliver it to any charity that helps feed people. It's all nutritious and would otherwise go to waste. Not only that, but it helps fight food poverty and reduces costs for hardworking organisations.

--

1.5 million people across London struggle with food poverty.

As a team of colleagues, we are working together on a week-long calorie burning challenge, raising money for the Felix Project as we go. We will be cycling, running and hiking, basically any exercise that is allowed at the moment, to burn 15,000 extra calories (specifically from this additional exercise) during the first week of December. Support provided will help deliver the target of 100,000 meals.

The Felix Project does wonderful work in London, delivering food to those that need it most across the city. Any support towards this cause is of great help, especially during these challenging times.

--

Thanks for your support! 

Zeynep, Fran, Pierre & Adam (AKA the Haribo All-Stars)
Title: Haribo All-Stars (Zeynep, Fran, Pierre & Adam) - Charity Challenge

Description:
Will you help us raise £5,000 to feed families in need this Christmas?

Breakfast, lunch, dinner. We don’t give a second thought to some meals.

Grabbed on the go, at your desk, at the table, in the kitchen. Sometimes in a restaurant. But what else can your meal do?

It can feed a child. It can help a country-wide network of food banks that want to change the status quo. It can buy food for a family and relief from hunger.

For the price of a meal you can change someone’s Christmas for the better. And that’s priceless.

There are more than 14 million people living in poverty in the UK –including 4.5 million children - and this Christmas is going to be
particularly difficult for many. 

The Trussell Trust, the UKs largest network of foodbanks, expects a 61 per cent increase in the number of food parcels needed this winter.

Join our campaign – donate the price of a meal

We’re supporting the Trust’s work and asking if you’ll also help by donating the price of a meal - whether that’s your lunch or the value of celebratory dinner for two - to a family in need.

About The Trussell Trust

The charity supports a nationwide network of foodbanks and provides emergency food and support to people locked in poverty, campaigning for change to end the need for foodbanks in the UK.

It supports over 1,200 foodbank centres in the UK – 40 in the South West – helping them provide a minimum of three days’ nutritionally-balanced emergency food to people who have been referred in crisis, as well as support to help people resolve the crises they face.

Between April 2019 and March 2020, foodbanks in its network provided a record 1.9 million food supplies to people in crisis, an 18 per cent increase on the previous year.

Donate now

Choose your option:

Sarnie and a coffee £4.50

Cafe brunch £9.50

Restaurant lunch £19

Slap-up dinner £40

Celebratory dinner for two £120

Thank you for your kindness.
Title: Food Christmas foodbank appeal

Description:
This winter will be tougher than most. But Londoners are there for each other. We will get through this, together.

In late March it became clear London faced an impending hunger crisis in the wake of Covid-19.

The Felix Project responded quickly and decisively. Within a fortnight, they were able to increase the equivalent meals delivered from 20k to over 100k daily. 

As of November, The Felix Project delivered in excess of 15 million meals this year -  more than double what they achieved last year at 6.4 million meals.

I am taking part in the 12 Days of Christmas Virtual Challenge because I want to help The Felix Project deliver as many as 20 million meals this year. 

Please donate to my page and ensure The Felix Project can rescue and redistribute nutritious, surplus food to those who need it most this winter.
Title: 12 Days of Christmas Virtual Challenge

Description:
Food poverty is on the rise in our local community.

In Bristol alone, an estimated 69,400 people (16% of the population) cannot afford a balanced diet. The number of families relying on food parcels has grown alarmingly in recent years, and food poverty among children is worryingly high with increasing numbers of children depending on food provision from schools.

However, FareShare South West are fighting back. They save good food from going to waste, redistribute it around the South West to charities, schools and community groups who turn it into meals for vulnerable people.

In support of this incredible charity, Arobase Creative and friends are taking on the Cairngorm 4000s challenge. 22 miles, over 2400 metres of elevation gain across 5 of the tallest mountains in Scotlands largest national park. 

The team: Tom Garland, Andrew Cadywould, Tom Fitzjohn & Matt Crowley. 

Please support generously, every £5 donated can provide food for up to 20 meals for those most in need.

Title: Leonie's 100km before Christmas

Description:
We have been learning at school about empathy and understanding others, so we thought by putting ourselves in other peoples shoes we could raise awareness and money. Our school family want to raise £100 towards giving a few families  a Christmas 🎄dinner. On the 28th Nov 2020,  We will go without food for 10hrs starting from waking at 7am  till 5pm. This is reflective of  fellow children who go to school each day hungry and spend many weekends hungry too. Myself - Amelia H, Millie L, Annalise and Sam B, Jasper, Henry W  &  Seb along with my younger brother Leyton who is 5 will go without food for 10hrs  from waking we will of course be having drinks. The cost of the meals we miss in this time period will then be donated via this page. We feel that this will not only help to give back to others but raise understanding of what it is like to go without the most basic necessities in life.

Title: Stepping in to Christmas

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

So firstly what is the 4x4x48 Challenge?

The 4x4x48 challenge includes running four miles at the top of every four hours, for 48 hours. This will result in running 48 total miles over the course of 48 hours. The 4x4x48 was inspired by retired Navy Seal and ultrarunner David Goggins. In the past, Goggins has described how he uses this workout to train for ultramarathons.

I will use the recently announced lockdown period to train for the specifics of the challenge and aim to start the challenge at 4 am on Thursday the 3rd of December which will run for 48 hours through until Saturday 5th at 00:00

All funds raised will go directly to an amazing charity FareShare who do great work in redistributing surplus food to charities that turn it into meals.

24,074 tonnes of food has been redistributed to charities supporting 933,178 people per week.

Any donation of any value would be greatly appreciated, and would go a long way to helping so many people who could go without this December.

Thanks, Nick
Title: Nicholas's 4x4x48 for Food

Description:
Between the 6 of us grads, we will be running the equivalent of the distance from Radbroke Hall to the new Glasgow Campus (225 miles). We will be splitting this distance between us, with each of us running 37.5 miles in the month of November. We plan to complete this challenge in time for World AIDS Day on 1st December.

National AIDS Trust is the UKs HIV rights charity. They work to stop HIV from standing in the way of health, dignity and equality, and to end new HIV transmissions. Their expertise, research and advocacy secure lasting change to the lives of people living with and at risk of HIV.

This is an exciting time to take part with a real opportunity to end new HIV transmissions in the UK by 2030. Your support will help them to get to this goal, and be a part of history.

Description:
FareShare fights hunger in the UK by redistributing good food which would otherwise go to waste to almost 11,000 frontline charities nationwide. We feed almost a million people a week but there's an urgent need to do more. Please join the fight against hunger and food waste and support FareShare today. 

Your donation will help provide vital funds to this charity and in return we'll send you a copy of our Lucion Lockdown Charity Cookbook.

Thank you!
Title: Sarah's Lucion Lockdown Charity Cookbook

Description:
Severn Hospice is dear to my heart, they do wonderful work, and looked after my dear mum lovingly.

Every Christmas we display a motley collection of abandoned Santa figures in the shop window of our Old Post Office home. What started with 9 lonely Santas is now more like 99! They're all thrilled to be out in public, especially after missing their Summer Holiday in the shop window this year. Passers by can give them a wave and put a donation in the Hospice collection box. I hope you'll enjoy the photos, and appreciate the wide variety of characters, from sad to mischievous Santas! Here in the first pic is "Big Daddy" Santa and me!
Title: Sue's "Chirk Bank Care Home for Abandoned Santas"

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

As a Club we have chosen to support Caresco by collecting donations of food for the Sawtry food bank as well as setting up this Just Giving page for monetary donations.

This year continues to be a real challenge for many people and families within our community and more people than ever are having to reach out to food banks for support during this Covid_19 pandemic. .

Please help us to help others and make a difference by donating to this page and/or making a food donation.

Food donations can be dropped off to Redwood Lodge, Buckworth, there will be a collection point at the front of the house. Suitable foods are:

  • Cereal, small box

  • Porridge
  • Instant single-serving sizes of flavoured porridge/cereal
  • Jam
  • Tinned:meat/tuna/potatoes/veg/beans/soup and fruit
  • Sugar, small bags preferred
  • Instant single-serving packets of heat-and-eat soups and noodles

  • Dried pasta
  • Pasta sauces
  • Crackers
  • Orange juice
  • Tea bags
  • Coffee, instant
  • Long life milk
  • Squash, small bottle
  • Christmas cake/Christmas Pudding 
  • Christmas Crackers 
  • Biscuits for Cheese

All food donations should be dropped off to Redwood Lodge by the 9th December as the food bank need time to deliver donations to local families in time for Christmas 🎄

Title: Buckworth Cricket Club Christmas Appeal 2020

Description: We're taking part in Save the Children's Christmas Jumper Day on Friday 11 December! It doesn't matter where we are - at home, work or school – on Christmas Jumper Day all you need to do is get your silliest, most festive jumper on and donate to Save the Children. By pulling on our Christmassy knits and donating, we'll be transforming the future for children. Every pound we raise will give children in the UK and around the world the chance to grow up healthy and happy, and change the future for good. Just £2 could pay for a bottle of hand sanitiser to help fight coronavirus in a Save the Children medical clinic, whilst £20 could pay for a back-to-school kit for a child in Indonesia. Simply click the donate button above to give your £2 (or more if you're feeling generous...) and help us reach our team target. We've also got our own QR code - simply scan the code with your phone camera and donate directly to our team! Not sure how it works? Here's a link to the handy guide on using QR codes: https://claim.savethechildren.org.uk/guide For more information on Save the Children’s Christmas Jumper Day, please visit https://christmasjumperday.org
Title: Our Christmas Jumper Day

Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

November is the month in which the founder of Sikhism and the first Guru of Sikhs, Guru Nanak Dev Ji was born. He saw serving to others as serving to God. He was given money to start his own business from his father but instead, he fed the hungry ascetics. Therefore now Sikhs mission is to provide basic needs such as food to all humanity which is why Sikh's Holy Temple- Gurudwara provides free food 24/7 called langar for everyone who wants to eat regardless of their race, religion and status. 

Similarly, the FoodCycle also provides tasty lunches and dinners every single day for people who are hungry and lonely. We believe every human being deserves to be fed. 

Please DONATE money and help those who are struggling to afford basic food.

Title: Student Executive WQE Fundraising

Description:
Brighton Housing Trust is a charity close to our hearts, doing fantastic work supporting homeless people in the city and across Sussex, providing them with food, clean clothes, hot showers, healthcare, mental health support and more. Last year the charity's advice services prevented nearly 1,000 households from becoming homeless. 

This year has been particularly tough for BHT and the people it supports, with many fundraising events cancelled. The money we'd usually spend on Secret Santa gifts could make a real difference. 

  • Just £5 could pay for hot drinks for the rough sleepers who visit First Base each morning after a cold night sleeping on the streets
  • £10 could cover the cost of a meal, clean clothes and hot shower for someone sleeping rough
  • A donation of £25 could run a support session for young people experiencing mental health problems. 

So give what you can, and Propellernet has kindly promised to match whatever we raise. Let's spread the Christmas joy and raise some cash!

Find out more about the First Base Centre here: https://www.bht.org.uk/services/homelessness/first-base-day-centre/ 

For more information on the BHT Christmas Appeal: https://www.bht.org.uk/fundraising-event/christmas-2020/

I love taking classes, and if you come to them you will know that I dance about like a dafty and put a lot of effort into choreographing them to give you the most enjoyment.

For more information on the classes, timetable and suggested donations, please see my Instagram page @kaytee_lifts

CharityName: World Food Programme - Prism the Gift Fund
Description:
The United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) feeds children in schools around the world, helping them grow, learn and thrive. 

Despite the demands of running a global fashion house, Michael Kors has always focused on giving back. In 2013 Michael Kors launched “Watch Hunger Stop,” partnering with the WFP to help fight world hunger. To date, Michael Kors has helped WFP deliver over 17 million meals to hungry children. In 2015 the designer was named Global Ambassador Against Hunger for the United Nations World Food Programme.

During the global pandemic WFP needs our help more than ever. Join us in supporting their essential work this Christmas. 

With each donation you will be entered into the Kors Christmas Raffle. Simply donate and enter your full name for the chance to win a jet set prize!

“Hunger is a complicated problem, but the simple truth is that if we work together, we can solve it,” said Michael Kors.

Together, we can help build a world with Zero Hunger.

Thank you for your donations!

Description:
In order to support charities that have been impacted during the coronavirus pandemic, our team which consists of 12 colleagues and I have come together to host a ‘Barclays Step Challenge campaign’.

  1. Arron Small
  2. Liz Stokes
  3. Timothy Beagle
  4. Claire Clarke
  5. Dolika Dhar
  6. Hassnain Kazmi
  7. Mark Lane
  8. David Whittaker
  9. Dinesh Hundalani
  10. Angela Bowden
  11. Johanna Sheppard
  12. Louise Sawle

Why have I nominated Cwtch Baby Bank:


Cwtch Baby Bank provide essential equipment which consists of clothing, toys and toiletries for new borns to children up to 2 years old. This can happen through referrals from social care, health professionals and other relevant support agencies.

Since launch in 2016, this particular charity has helped over 2,600 families and have made a difference to their lives in one way or another.

During the pandemic, organisations such as this one have been impacted by restrictions such as a reduction on volunteers available to assist with the sorting and the distribution of soft goods.

How will the challenge work? 

The Step Challenge will have a collective step goal of 1 million steps, which will run for two weeks. To achieve this goal, we’ll be running, walking and jogging for ten consecutive working days. To help measure activity, we’ll be tracking steps using fitness trackers reportable daily.

How much will we be attempting to raise?

Our Barclays team will be aiming to raise £300.00 across a variety of connected fundraising pages. The funds will be divided amongst all nominated charities. Barclays offer a Matched Funding programme, which is currently being reviewed. If this application is approved, the funds total may be doubled subject to conditions being met.
