Description:
*Edit - the chop will be taking place on 04/12/2020. 


I've been growing my hair for over 4 years (all by myself, without anyone else's help) and feel that it is now time for a change. I will no longer be beponytailed. I am acutely aware that beponytailed is probably not a real word, so please pay it no heed if it annoys you. The government is doing that school dinner thing that's well bad n stuff, so I figured this may be a productive way to make myself look sharper than one of Yan Can Cook's (I'm not actually that old, but if you are then you will know!) chopping knives, whilst helping out some vulnerable people during these particularly challenging times. Just to make it certain, I am not going to go full on Richard O'Brien regardless of how much I enjoyed the Crystal Maze. It will be completely chopped off and in a somewhat more normal and socially acceptable style. DONATE YOUR CLOTHES, YOUR BOOTS AND YOUR MOTORCYCLE. Or just chuck a few quid towards this good cause. Obviously, the timing of this depends entirely on whether or not hairdressers are open by then as I don't intend to do it myself! Thanks in advance, you charitable humans.

Description:
In times when we have been advised to stay safe by staying at home it becomes evident that housing is one of the main health influences in our lives. Measures such as self isolation, increased hygiene, staying at home, strict social distancing are not a realistic prospect for people experiencing homelessness.

The Nomad Centre, part of the YMCA Lincolnshire, is the only 24/7 direct access night shelter service in Lincolnshire and they provide shelter to over 18s in the form of a bed in a private en-suite room, three meals a day, laundry and a safe supportive environment.  Their incredible service helps residents move forward with their lives to gain access to health care, support services and long-term suitable accommodation.  

Like many charities this year, the YMCA Lincolnshire has seen major fundarising events cancelled and income producing enterprises such as the events centre and café closed which has caused a devastating impact on income.

Fine and Country Lincolnshire and Grantham have worked closely with the YMCA Lincolnshire for over two years and we feel incredibly proud to be sponsoring the food costs for all residents during the 12 Days of Christmas. 

We would love to give more and so we are asking for your help to Give the Gift of Food and Comfort this Christmas to the homeless residents of the Nomad Centre.  It costs £5.50 per day for the centre to provide three meals to one resident and a total daily food cost of £110.  If any individuals or businesses are in the fortunate position at this challenging time of year to be able to help with the gift of food it would be so incredibly kind if you could pledge a meal or more via our Just Giving page and The Fine and Country Foundation will donate 100% of the funds raised to the YMCA Lincolnshire.

We appreciate not everyone is in a position to donate so we are also asking for the gift of comfort.  If you could spare a moment to write some words of comfort and hope to a resident of the Nomad Centre we would be so very grateful.  Please email a message to lincoln@fineandcountry.com or post a message / card to our office Fine and Country, 55 High Street, Navenby, Lincoln, LN5 0DZ and we will ensure every message is printed out and given directly to the residents this Christmas.

Thank you so much for taking the time to visit our Just Giving page.

Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

Description:
Insight Recruitment is helping Mustard Tree combat food poverty.


You can too.

This year has been tough for everyone, however, the pandemic has affected the most vulnerable in our society most strongly. Mustard Tree has noted that in covering demand, their food costs have increased from £4,000 a month, to £6,500 a week. 

Insight Recruitment has pledged to support Mustard Tree to help in the fight against poverty. 

No one should go hungry this winter.

WHAT INSIGHT WILL BE DOING TO HELP MUSTARD TREE:

- Weekly food collections
- Filling crates for Christmas
- Promoting the Mustard Tree cause through our network
- Special campaigns...

OUR CAMPAIGNS:

INSIGHT ACTIVE CLUB

Rather than slowing down in the lead up to Christmas - it's fitness at the ready! Our consultants will be embracing activity,  running, walking & cycling with the collective goal of getting to Lapland by Friday 18 December (2091km).

TRADE A DRINK FOR A WARM MEAL

We will be encouraging individuals to donate the cost of a coffee to help in the provision of a warm meal.

Also, at a business level, while we can't celebrate the week's end, group incentives, or festive parties, we can come together in a different way. We're asking business to contribute part of their party budgets to help the vulnerable - trading work drinks for warm meals.

More information about Mustard Tree:

Mustard Tree has an established track record over the past 25 years, supporting people across Greater Manchester in poverty and facing homelessness. We create opportunities for people to help themselves through providing practical support, friendship, connections into work, improvements to health and wellbeing plus new experiences to encourage aspiration.
Title: Combat Poverty with Mustard Tree this Winter

Title: Food for GOSH charity

Description:
Sometimes, we are known to become awfully ungrateful. We complain about this work worry or that one; about public transport, about certain things being 'less-than' for us, and more. But while we find we have more than 'enough' to survive and live, in Yemen, people are dying as a result of things like being unable to access clean water. The Yemeni crisis is one whose direness will increase with the coming of the colder months. 

Donate towards providing Winter Kits for vulnerable families in Yemen. May Allah (SWT) reward you immensely for your Sadaqah, Ameen. 

£315 will provide a Winter Kit to a vulnerable family in Yemen, containing warm clothes, blankets, food, water and mattresses for the whole family, helping them to survive winter.

Each member of the family will receive:

  • a high thermal blanket
  •  a comfortable mattress
  • food
  • water
  •  warm winter clothes customised to age and gender including: winter fleece pyjamas, jackets, socks, woollen hats and scarves, thermal underwear, and shawls.

After five years of continuous conflict, the humanitarian crisis in Yemen is the worst in the world. 20 million Yemenis need help securing food and a staggering 14 million people are in acute humanitarian need. 

230 of Yemen’s 333 districts are now food insecure. 

For the first time in Yemen, assessments confirm the presence of catastrophic levels of hunger. 

7.4 million people, nearly a quarter of the entire population, are malnourished, many acutely so.

In winter, while the climate varies greatly depending on location, changing weather can bring huge challenges to already vulnerable Yemeni families. 

Rainfall comes in irregular, heavy torrents and the country experiences coolness with frequent frost. Temperatures can plummet from 22 degrees Celsius to below freezing at its coldest. 

This winter, nearly 400,000 people are at critical risk of facing loss of life due to both the current crisis and upcoming severity of frost this season.

This winter, Human Appeal Yemen will be supporting 1,281 of the most vulnerable people in Almahweet and Ibb governorates who are in dire need of winter support.

Human Appeal Yemen will be taking measures to reduce the risk of spreading COVID-19 amongst the beneficiaries and the distribution team by taking the following actions: instructing beneficiaries to maintain 1-2 metres distance from each other throughout the distribution process, and clearly marking the allocated spaces at the distribution sites, increasing the number of distribution sites / outlets to avoid large gatherings, staggering distribution cycles and loading procedures to reduce frequency of gatherings and changing packaging, setting up hand washing areas with adequate supplies of hand wash solution (0.05% chlorine solution or soapy water).Organising winter kit assistance packs ahead of the scheduled distribution. Carefully controlling and mitigating against any crowding at distribution sites.
Title: Winter Kits for Yemen

Description:
Hello lovely people,

I usually choose a different charity each year, but I'm sticking with Trussel Trust again this time because I know that so many of us are struggling to find enough money for food at this very stressful time. I always enjoy raising money together because I can't afford to make a large donation on my own, but when I offer a prize we can all come together to make more of an impact and maybe that might bring you a bit of cheer on a drizzly afternoon. I know it will for me.

So this year I am offering a collection of flower stems. 

This bouquet consists of 11 individual stems of handmade paper flowers:

2 peach roses

1 mint green spidermum

1 dusky pink peony, with lighter petals in the middle

2 chrysanthemums; one peach and one pale green

1 green zinnia

4 jasmine stems

The bouquet stands at 26 cm (11 inches) tall. Each flower is a slightly different height. The flowers are made from hand painted 300 gsm recycled watercolour paper, which is really rather sturdy. Their stems are copper coated steel. Some have been wrapped in a dark green floristry tape. Some brush marks naturally occur on the petals from the painting process.

Glass jar not included. They will arrive gift wrapped, in a box with ribbon.

(&If you hate the colour scheme, don't worry- I'll make you some blue/pink/yellow ones instead! Flower types will be of my choosing.)

IMPORTANT:

Just Giving does not share your details with me. Please email kaperkate@gmail.com to let me know you've made a donation.

£5 per entry.

If you pledge £10, you will have an extra chance to win (+ each additional £5 you pledge).

And if you're super generous & donate £20+, send me your address in your email, because I will send you a little parcel of original drawings, bird badges etc to let you know how lovely you are. 

I'll draw the winner from a hat on the 1st December. 

DON'T FORGET TO EMAIL ME, SO I HAVE A WAY OF CONTACTING YOU. I will not use your email for any other purpose than to contact you regarding this raffle.

Thank you! And keep your chin up, lovely people. We're going to make it through this. But do reach out if you need a hand to hold. I've got marigolds & sanitiser at the ready.

About Trussel Trust:

Last year, food banks in our network provided more than 1.6 million emergency food parcels to people in crisis. More than half a million of these went to children. It’s not right that people can’t afford the basics. With your help, we can help end the need for food banks.As a nation, we expect no one should be left hungry or destitute. Illness, disability, family breakdown or the loss of a job can happen to any of us. With your help #ThisCanChange
Title: Kate's Raffle

Description:
On Thursday 10th December at 16:30 join the CSR team for HelloFresh's first Xmas charity raffle in aid of Fareshare!

FareShare fights hunger in the UK by redistributing good food which would otherwise go to waste to almost 11,000 frontline charities nationwide. They feed almost a million people a week but there's an urgent need to do more. Join the fight against hunger and food waste and support FareShare today.

Raffle tickets will be priced at £1 per ticket, with a minimum spend of £5. The more tickets you buy the higher your chances to win a number fabulous prizes!!

How to get your tickets:

  1. Click 'Give Now' to buy your chosen amount of tickets for the raffle (Remember £1 will buy you one Raffle ticket, so the more you buy the higher your chance to win one of the amazing prizes!!)
  2. Do not hide your donation amount so we can track how many tickets you have bought!
  3. Do not hide your name. We need this so we can track how many tickets you have bought!
  4. Cross your fingers and kiss that lucky clover ready for 10th December
Watch out in the Garlic Press for upcoming teasers of what you can win!

Thanks and best of luck!

CSR Team.
Title: HelloFresh Charity Raffle

Description:
Danske Bank is proud to announce that it has appointed Extern as its charity partner in 2020. Operating since 1978, Extern supports over 20,000 people each year to change their lives.

Our charity partnership is focusing on making more possible for thousands of vulnerable and socially deprived young people in Northern Ireland, who are supported by Extern each year.

Social deprivation a very real and alarming issue in Northern Ireland, with as many as one in four children here living in poverty. In addition, in Northern Ireland in 2018/19, there were 3,281 children living in care.

Money raised through our partnership will enable Extern to provide new opportunities for such vulnerable young people, including the development of much-needed sensory spaces and a sensory garden at its Kinnahalla Respite Centre in the Mourne Mountains. Every week at Kinnahalla, Extern care for children who need emergency care, respite from a crisis in the home, or when a care placement breaks down.
Title: Nicola's Danske Bank HR Fall Forfeit

CharityName: The Kit Wilson Trust for Animal Welfare
Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.

The Kit Wilson Trust for Animal Welfare is appealing for donations towards our Christmas Food Appeal.  Winter is always our most expensive time at the Rescue Centre and with Covid-19 affecting all our fundraising this year, now more than ever we need your donations.

Our Appeal is so important in helping us feed the many animals in our care over Christmas and into the New Year. All our dogs and cats at the Centre deserve a home to call their own, and while they are waiting for that special person to come along to make it a reality for them, we try our best to make their Christmas as happy as it can be! With your help we can do that.

Although we usually have donation boxes at host sites around Sussex and Kent, this year it will be very different with some businesses not able to take a box due to closure or simply not wanting to encourage a larger footfall during these uncertain times.

We know it's not always possible for people, who want to donate, to get to the ones that will still be able to have a donation box  which is why we have set up our JustGiving page for monetary donations.

The Rescue Centre caters for dogs, cats, rabbits, guinea pigs, ferrets and rodents, and is also a permanent home to other animals such as, ponies, goats, birds and sheep.  The Centre is also involved in the rehabilitation of wildlife.

Thank you so much for thinking of the animals at this time of year. We, and the animals, really do appreciate it.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.
Title: The Kit Wilson Trust for Animal Welfare 2020 Christmas Food Appeal

Title: People Team Cash for Kids Mission Christmas

Description:
At Ninth Bradford North, we are hoping to raise £50 (or more!) to help the wonderful folks at Yorkshire Cat Rescue to feed all the Cats and Kittens in their care over the Christmas period.

This year has been especially hard for charities as their shops and fundraising events have been shut down at every step. Let's bring some joy this Christmas by sharing a few £s to help out a fantastic charity.

Many of our families have had a hard year too - every donation helps, no matter how small. We usually run a 'Reverse Advent Calendar' to collect food, litter and toys - and you have been amazing at donating hundreds of items. Sadly Covid has prevented this being viable, so this year we are taking a slightly different approach. If you would prefer to donate an item rather than money, you can see what the charity need at: https://yorkshirecatrescue.org/donate-stuff-we-need

Thank you for reading. :)

Title: Ferndale's Ferndale Community Radio's Appeal for Childrens Food Famine

Description:
Christmas can be a hard time of year for some families, and this year in the midst of a global pandemic and nation wide redundancies now, more than ever they need your help.

Everyday we take for granted the food in our cupboards while some families go hungry. Therefore,   we have decided to raise money for the Chelmsford Salvation Army so they can provide food parcels to families and children in need this Christmas. 

Just £30 will provide a food parcel for a family of 4 for a whole week! From this fundraiser we would love to be able to feed 100 families this Christmas so, we ask that whatever you can spare, please donate and help us to give a family the gift of food.
Title: 25K for the 25th Day

Description:
I’ve been challenged to do a food eating challenge by friends so I’m hoping to make it into a charitable event to raise some much needed moneys for a well deserved local hospice. 

Myself and chandler are going to be taking on the dreaded “suströming” rotten fermented fish eating challenge. Trust me when I say neither of us are looking forward to attempting this challenge, it is however for a great cause so please please help us help them by donating anything you can to help those who need it the most. 

It’s not going to be easy to watch us both undergo this challenge as most people who’ve attempted this normally get covered in vomit!  Yes vomit, this apparent delicacy is one of the worlds most smelliest dishes so be warned! 

We are both going to donate our stomachs and hopefully raise a decent chunk of money to help this much needed hospice. So please again anything is better than nothing so please dig deep🙏🏻 And share our post to raise awareness and hopefully raise more funds. 

We would both like to thank you for any donations, but don’t wish to thank the friends who have challenged us to do this revolting deed. 

WATCH THIS SPACE xxx
Title: PAUL & Chandlers food challenge.

Description: here has never been a greater need for The Hygiene Bank to address this social injustice, so take a stand and join us in our campaign. We're saying #BOGOF to hygiene poverty, and want you to do the same. Find as many Buy One Get One Free deals on hygiene products as you can, keep a product for yourself, and then donate the other. Then, share your great deal and good deed on social media to let others know where they can do the same!
Title: Katherine’s page

CharityName: The Last Night A DJ Saved My Life Foundation
Description:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

During these crazy difficult times it's easy to forget others that are in much worse situation than us. These people can benefit greatly from us sharing our love with them by simply donating whatever we can, even a £. We can't change the world, but we can definitely contribute to making it a better one.
Title: DJ-Jose DSB

Description: Galvanised by the belief that being clean is not a luxury or a privilege, The Hygiene Bank is a registered, people powered, grassroots charity grounded in community. We collect and re-distribute donated toiletries, hygiene, beauty and personal care items to UK charities, voluntary organisations and schools. These in turn are then given for free to their beneficiaries. Our passion stems from a sense of injustice: it's not right that anyone should face hygiene poverty in modern Britain.
Title: Kirsten Hartley Mediclinic Christmas Appeal

Description:
To celebrate my mother's 65th birthday we are working to raise enough money to purchase and sponsor an assistance dog for Dogs for Good. My mother's brave but horrible battle with Alzheimers continues but so does her decline. She has started to not recognise her own family and friends and often doesn’t know where she is or what is going on; causing significant period of emotional stress for her. 

My mother's world is shrinking fast and if it wasn't for 'her Diva' she would have limited social interaction and emotional support.  This is why we are supporting my Dad's fund raising efforts. Please visit the link Tina's brave fight with Alzheimer's above for the full story.

As part of this fundraising Conor and I are, for the next 12 months, going to ration the number of fast food meals that we have every month and donate the savings. We have committed to saving and donating at least £50 per month. 

If you would also like to support us and help us celebrate my mother's brave fight with Alzheimer's we would be extremely grateful for your support. Thank you so much for any help that you can give.
Title: My Mum's fight with Alzheimers

Description: Children and young people across the UK are currently facing a multitude of challenges, including illness, poverty, mental health problems, isolation, loneliness and social injustice. Sadly, the coronavirus pandemic has made life even harder for those who were already experiencing difficulties in their lives. This year Toyota and BBC Children in Need are coming together to change the lives of children and young people all across the UK.
Title: Bank Hall's page
